body_html:
You mean if the version string is semver compliant?
Looking at semver.org, it seems that "0rc" is not a valid patch since it can't have leading zeros.
Also, the whl files are currently a bit funny - 0.12.0-0rc-0rc... (so 0rc twice).

I think what we might want to do is to set TF_PATCH_VERSION in tensorflow/core/public/version.h to 0-rc0 but remove the hyphen from the filenames of the .whls

Looking at semver.org, it seems that "0rc" is not a valid patch since it can't have leading zeros.
Also, the whl files are currently a bit funny - 0.12.0-0rc-0rc... (so 0rc twice).
I think what we might want to do is to set TF_PATCH_VERSION in tensorflow/core/public/version.h to 0-rc0 but remove the hyphen from the filenames of the .whls
body:
You mean if the version string is semver compliant? 
Looking at semver.org, it seems that "0rc" is not a valid patch since it can't have leading zeros.
Also, the whl files are currently a bit funny - 0.12.0-0rc-0rc... (so 0rc twice).

I think what we might want to do is to set `TF_PATCH_VERSION` in `tensorflow/core/public/version.h` to `0-rc0` but remove the hyphen from the filenames of the `.whl`s
